2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_name: 2 year college access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.short_description: Index of 2-year college accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.long_description: Demand = whole population, supply = total number of students enrolled in a year (graduate and undergraduate)
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.name: National Center for Education Statistics
2year_colleges_access_scores:norm_2sefca.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.long_name: 2-year college access by median dive time to the five closest colleges in minutes
drive_times_nearest_2year_colleges:media.name: National Center for Education Statistics

3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.long_name: Median percent of 3rd grade population passing reading test
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.statement: The median percent of 3rd graders with passing reading scores in {region_name} is {median_read_pass_rate} percent
3rd_grade_median_read_score:median_read_.name: Virginia Department of Education

daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.long_name: Day care access score (3-step floating catchment area)
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.short_description: Index of day care accessibility based on supply of and demand for providers
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. Demand = 0-12 years, supply = day care capacity
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.statement: The daycare accessibility score for {region_name} is  {daycare_norm_3sfca}
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.name: Virginia Department of Social Services
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_n.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.long_name: Access to day care by count
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.short_description: Count of day cares based on provider locations
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.long_description: Count of day cares based on provider locations. Address data was collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.  Day care capacity count
daycare_services_access_scores:daycare_c.name: Virginia Department of Social Services

drive_times_nearest_daycares:median_driv.long_name: Day care access by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
drive_times_nearest_daycares:median_driv.name: Virginia Department of Social Services

dei_index:norm_dei.statement: The digital equity index for {region_name} is {norm_dei}

dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.long_name: Dental care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.short_description: Index of dental care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.long_description: Dental care access score based on 2-step ehanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.statement: The dental care access score for {region_name} is {dent_e2sfca}
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.name: SafeGraph Core
dentist_access_scores:dent_e2sfca.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

dentist_access_scores:dent_cnt.short_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations
dentist_access_scores:dent_cnt.long_description: Count of dentists based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
dentist_access_scores:dent_cnt.name: SafeGraph Core

download_speeds:download.statement: The average download speed for internet connections in {region_name} is {download} MB/s
download_speeds:download.name: Ookla

trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_name: Trade school access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.short_description: Index of trade school accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.long_description: Demand = whole population, supply = total number of students enrolled in a year ( undergraduate)
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.name: National Center for Education Statistics
trade_schools_access_scores:norm_3sfca.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.long_name: Trade school access by median drive time to the five closest schools in minutes
drive_times_nearest_trade_schools:median.name: National Center for Education Statistics

have_computer:perc_have_computer.long_name: Percent of population with a computer
have_computer:perc_have_computer.name: American Community Survey

have_internet:perc_have_internet_access.long_name: Percent of population with internet access
have_internet:perc_have_internet_access.name: American Community Survey

health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.name: Medical Expenditure Panel Survey; American Community Survey
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.citations: Stavitz et al. (2020); Liang and Branch (2017)

no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.long_name: Percent of population without health insurance
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.short_description: Percent of the population self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.long_description: Percent of the population self-reported to not be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan. This data comes from Question 16 of the Person section of the American Community Survey.
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.statement: {no_hlth_ins_pct} percent of the population has no health insurance in  {region_name}
no_health_insurance_19_to_64:no_hlth_ins.name: American Community Survey

obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.long_name: OBGYN care access score (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.short_description: Index of OBGYN care accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.long_description: OBGYN care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.statement: The OBGYN access score for {region_name}  is {obgyn_e2sfca}
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.name: WebMD Physician Directory
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_e2sfca.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_cnt.short_description: Count of OBGYNs based on provider locations
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_cnt.long_description: Count of OBGYN care providers based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
obgyn_access_scores:obgyn_cnt.name: WebMD Physician Directory

pct_pop_broadband:perc_w_broadband.statement: {perc_w_broadband} percent of the population in {region_name} has a broadband connection
pct_pop_broadband:perc_w_broadband.name: American Community Survey

pct_pop_cable_fiber_dsl:perc_w_cable_fib.short_name: Population with cable, fiber optic, or DSL
pct_pop_cable_fiber_dsl:perc_w_cable_fib.long_name: Percent of population with a high speed internet service (cable, fiber optic, or DSL)
pct_pop_cable_fiber_dsl:perc_w_cable_fib.statement: {perc_w_cable_fiber_DSL} percent of the population in {region_name} has a cable fiber or DSL internet connection
pct_pop_cable_fiber_dsl:perc_w_cable_fib.name: American Community Survey

pediatrics_access_scores:ped_e2sfca.long_name: Pediatric care access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
pediatrics_access_scores:ped_e2sfca.short_description: Index of pediatric care physician accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
pediatrics_access_scores:ped_e2sfca.name: WebMD Physician Directory

pediatrics_access_scores:ped_cnt.short_description: Count of pediatricians based on provider locations
pediatrics_access_scores:ped_cnt.name: WebMD Physician Directory

post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.long_name: Percent  of population with post-high school education
post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.name: American Community Survey

preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.long_name: Preventable hospital stays per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.short_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.long_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees. Ambulatory care refers to diagnoses that are usually treatable in outpatient settings. This data is based on Medicare claims and comes from County Health Rankings.
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.statement: {prevent_hosp_rate} percent of the hospitalizations in {region_name}  were preventable (due to conditions usually treated in outpatient settings)
preventable_hospitalizations:prevent_hos.name: County Health Rankings

primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.long_name: Primary care access score (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.short_description: Index of primary care physician accessibility based on supply and demand of providers
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.long_description: Primary care access score based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.statement: The primary care accessibility score for {region_name}  is  {primacare_e2sfca}
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.name: WebMD Physician Directory
primary_care_access_scores:prim_e2sfca.citations: Lou, Wei (2004); Lou, Wei and Yi Qi (2009); Lou, Wei and Fahui Wang (2003); Saxon, James et al. (2020)

primary_care_access_scores:prim_cnt.short_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations
primary_care_access_scores:prim_cnt.long_description: Count of primary care physicians based on provider locations. Address data was collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
primary_care_access_scores:prim_cnt.statement: There are {primacare_cnt} primary care physicians in {region_name}
primary_care_access_scores:prim_cnt.name: WebMD Physician Directory
